THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON
10.01.2019, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING:

Crl.MC.No. 230 of 2019 3 201SIKERITS37
ORDER

Petition filed under Section 482 Cr.P.C.

2. Petitioners are the accused in C.C.No. 59
of 2016 on the file of the Judicial Magistrate of
First Class-I, Hosdurg. They are alleged to have
committed the offences under Sections 143, 147,
148, 323 and 324 IPC. The first accused is no
more. Respondents 2 and 3 are the victims. Tt
is submitted that the matter has been settled
and the proceedings in the trial court may be
quashed.

3. Heard the learned counsel for the
petitioners and respondents 2 and 3 and the
learned Public Prosecutor.

4. 1 have perused the affidavits filed by
respondents 2 and 3, who have entered appearance
through counsel. I am satisfied that the matter
has been settled and no public interest is
involved in this case. There is no impediment
for granting the prayer of the petitioners.

Crl.MC.No. 230 of 2019 4 2019/KERIIS37
In the result, this Crl.M.C is allowed. The
proceedings in C.C.No. 59 of 2016 on the file of
the Judicial Magistrate of First Class-I, Hosdurg
are quashed. If any material objects have been
produced in this case, the trial court may pass
appropriate orders for their disposal.
Sd/-
K.ABRAHAM MATHEW
JUDGE
MC/14.1.19
